comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: See NYT of Feb 20, 1914 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9F0CE3D91730E733A... Second article in this extract says that the previous night, the Berkeley Theater was appropriated by the Society of Illustrators for a smoker and two playlets.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The Society of Illustrators still exists. See www.societyillustrators.org/About-the-Society/History/His... . It was founded in 1901. Mentioned as members are "Howard Pyle, Maxfield Parish, N.C. Wyeth, Charles Dana Gibson, Frederic Remington, James Montgomery Flagg, Howard Chandler Christy " The history on the website indicates that women were welcomed as full members in the twenties. I suspect the female characters in this picture are in drag. Would others agree?

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: The Society of Illustrators is a professional society based in New York City founded in 1901. The mission of the Society is to promote the art and appreciation of illustration, as well as its history and evolving nature, and to encourage high ideals through exhibitions, lectures, education, and by fostering a sense of community and open discussion. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Society_of_Illustrators
